title: Affect-Based Teaching Agents and Metacognitive Promotion Strategies in Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic psychological concepts and understanding of online learning tools
context.additional_context: Learners possess advanced expertise in language learning domains and are accustomed to asynchronous learning using digital devices; learning outcomes are measured through project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of affective-based pedagogical agents on learning motivation and concentration.
Learners can establish and execute self-directed learning plans by applying metacognitive facilitation strategies.
Learners can improve language learning achievement by over 20% through emotional regulation and integration of cognitive strategies in online environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
